strings.Value: "How are you?"
"I see Elina is trying very hard to please you."
"Why did you never tell me about Ntavi?"
[Point at a glass] "Drink with me?"
"I hope we didn't do more harm than good. Are you at least having fun?"
"Why did you stop talking?"
"I see."
"How did you meet Ntavi?"
"Were you close?"
"Tired of fighting? Ready to lie down and give up?"
"Want to change the subject?"
[Leave] "I'm going to get something to eat."
"Help yourself. It's time to relax!"
"Elina's wine is quite good. It's your choice, though."
[Shrug and sip from your glass]
"Don't force yourself if you don't feel like it."
[Remain silent]
"Don't submit to despair. Deep inside you want to be happy again — and your family would want the same for you. Don't be ashamed of the moments where joy returns to your life."
"What do you mean?"
"I think this is more than a sense of obligation."
"Does it not ruin your fun?"
"Yes. It was my idea, after all."
"It was a team effort — Linzi, Elina, Ntavi..."
"You know Linzi. She has a creative mind."
"Let's talk about something else."
"Sometimes our feelings scare us... but your grief and your anger are justified. One can't order one's heart to stop seeking revenge and justice."
"Only you can decide what path is right for you. I believe you will make the correct choice."
"And that's it? You have nothing else to tell me?"
"Enough whining. Pull yourself together."
{n}The ranger greets you with a curt nod.{/n}
"Your Grace must want to talk to Ekun. I'll go make sure everyone has enough to drink."
{n}Ekun shrugs.{/n} "Why?"
{n}The ranger rubs the back of his head, then smirks.{/n} "Amanda. Said, 'A caravan is here — you'll go to the tavern again! Ntavi is a bad influence!' And then Ntavi started coming less and less..."
{n}Ekun nods.{/n}
"Guarded caravans. She talked a lot. I thought: 'She must be in love with her own voice.'" {n}Ekun winces.{/n}
{n}Ekun chuckles and nods confidently.{/n} "It's good to be among friends and trees. And better still — not holding a bow."
{n}Ekun looks at the grass beneath his feet.{/n} "As fire and wind."
"We are friends. And friends leave — but stay anyway."
{n}Ekun looks uncertainly at the offered glass.{/n}
{n}Ekun resolutely shakes his head.{/n} "No. Thank you."
{n}Ekun is silent for a moment, then pours himself some wine and tastes it… then his face relaxes slightly.{/n} "Not bad."
{n}Ekun nods and the tension leaves his shoulders.{/n}
"As always."
"Life is life. It goes on... whether we wish it or not."
{n}Ekun tugs at the buttons of his jacket and lowers his head.{/n}
{n}A faint smile spreads on Ekun's face.{/n} "There is very much of her. All at once. However... she is a good woman."
{n}Looking at Elina's back, Ekun turns to you, fixing one of his belt bags.{/n} "Cunning plan. To bring a hunter to a feast, call him to hunt."

{n}Ekun stares into the distance.{/n} "I wake up with the first rays of sun — I see the faces of my family. Fire turns to ashes, midday turns to midnight — and when the stars are shining I still think of them."
"I find it interesting to look at faces, listen to what they say to each other. I... missed it."
{n}Ekun nods.{/n} "It's good to be among friends and trees. And even better — not holding a bow."
"She is the lady of the house. This is her responsibility."
"And you, according to Elina." {n}Ekun is silent for a while.{/n} "Thank you."
"Elina told me. Thank you."
"Hmm."
"Uh-huh."
{n}Ekun shrugs.{/n} "It's good to be among trees."
"I started living with Amanda. And Ntavi left with a caravan."
"And then the desert taught her to close her mouth. Sand gets in." {n}Ekun smiles slightly, but his eyes are joyful.{/n}
{n}Ekun shrugs nonchalantly.{/n}
"I... thought about it. Time will tell."
{n}Ekun studies his calloused palms.{/n}
{n}Ekun's eyes flare.{/n} "What do you know of how I live?"
{n}Ekun's face is still.{/n} "You will not put me out. No point trying."
"I am still thinking about them."

"Some days bitterness and rage fill me — I drive them away. Other days I feel a smile on my face and I appall myself. Only hunting numbs my feelings. But the farther I follow the trail, the darker the woods are... and the harder it is to find my way back."
{n}Ekun sighs heavily and looks away.{/n}
{n}Ekun looks down. After a long silence he speaks, noticeably relieved.{/n} "Your eyes look deep. Sometimes too deep. Thank you, {name}."
{n}Ekun's face is blank.{/n} "Your words can't hurt me."
{n}Listening to you, Ekun sighs heavily, but determination is written on his face.{/n} "I suppose you're right. One can't be scared and leave these woods behind."
{n}Ekun smiles slightly.{/n} "Easier said than done. But there is wisdom in your words."
